oai_dc:dc.dc:title: THE MONITORING OF RUBBLE MOUND BREAKWATER STABILITY USING A PHOTOGRAPHIC SURVEY METHOD
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kluger, J.W.J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: breakwater
breakwater stability
rubble mound breakwater
photography
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A method of surveying the above-water slope of breakwaters by means of photography has been developed at the National Research Institute for Oceanology. The method is simple and inexpensive and yet capable of detecting movement or displacement of a single armour unit on a breakwater. This poster paper describes the method and presents some examples of its application in the field.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 18 (1982): Proceedings of 18th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Cape Town, South Africa, 1982.; 129
